abstract: Joseph F Traub, educator, founder of computer science department at Columbia University and founding chairman of the Computer Science and Telecommunications Board of the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering and Medicine who dedicated life to  quantum research and computer sciences, dies at age 83.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Traub, who founded the computer science department at Columbia, helped the emerging academic discipline garner respectability and resources.

headline.main: Joseph F. Traub, 83, Dies; Early Advocate for Computer Science
headline.print_headline: Joseph F. Traub, 83, Dies; Early Advocate for Computer Science

snippet: Mr. Traub, who founded the computer science department at Columbia, helped the emerging academic discipline garner respectability and resources.
